info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:53PM MDT until July 20 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL EL PASO AND NORTH CENTRAL PUEBLO COUNTIES... At 252 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hanover to near Pinon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather station measured 58 mph winds south of Fountain. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fountain, Security-Widefield and Fort Carson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
